base64.description: Whether or not the server should base64 decode the value before storing it. Useful for writing values that wouldn't otherwise be valid JSON strings, such as images.

expiration.description: The time, measured in number of seconds since the UNIX epoch, at which the key should expire.

expiration_ttl.description: The number of seconds for which the key should be visible before it expires. At least 60.

key.description: A key's name. The name may be at most 512 bytes. All printable, non-whitespace characters are valid.

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON that is associated with a key.

value.description: A UTF-8 encoded string to be stored, up to 25 MiB in length.
